metadata.description: This dataset contains land cover products in Qilian Mountain Area in 2020. The dataset was produced based on the product in 2019 using change monitoring method on the Google Earth Engine platform using Landsat series data. The overall accuracy of this product is above 85%. This is a continuation of the products from 1985-2019.
metadata.descriptionCn: 本数据集为祁连山区域2020年的30m土地覆盖分类产品。该产品以2019年的土地覆盖分类产品为基础，基于Google Earth Engine平台的Landsat系列数据和强大地数据处理能力，利用变化检测的思想和方法生产得到，总体精度优于85%。该产品是1985-2019年土地覆盖分类产品的延续。1985-2019年的土地覆盖分类产品也可在本网站下载得到。其中，1985-2015年的土地利用产品为5年1期，2015-2020年的土地利用产品为1年1期。

background: Land-cover datasets are crucial for research on eco-hydrological processes and earth system modeling. Remote sensing has become widely used as a macro-observing system for land-cover mapping, which can substitute for plant functional type (PFT) as the baseline. Several moderate to fine resolution global land-cover datasets, which are presented in detail in Table I, based on different satellite sensors are available from different research groups. These land-cover datasets listed in Table I have large variability for three reasons: 1) the data quality and properties are different; 2) there is no standard approach for classifying continuous vegetation cover into discrete categories; and 3) they are not consistent with the Earth System Model’s (ESM) requirements, because the concept of PFT, whose traits represent a combination of spectral relationships, and climatic, ecological, and theoretical assumptions, used in ESMs cannot be mapped directly using remote-sensing land-cover datasets. In addition, the classification accuracies of land-cover datasets vary and are hardly suited for land-process modeling and applications at a river basin scale. The highest uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery occurs most frequently between the cropland and grassland categories and in dryland systems among the shrub, grassland, and forest categories because of differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover. For the HRB, most are distributed over an arid region, so the vegetation classification in the HRB based on current land-cover datasets would cause very large uncertainty and may cause great error or even the failure of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling.
research objective: In order to improve the accuracy of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling in the HRB, a comprehensive method for mapping monthly land cover with fine spatial resolution and more categories of crop/vegetation is developed by using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data with different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands.
challenges: The highest uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery occurs most frequently between the cropland and grassland categories and in dryland systems among the shrub, grassland, and forest categories because of differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover. For the HRB, most are distributed over an arid region, so the vegetation classification in the HRB based on current land-cover datasets would cause very large uncertainty and may cause great error or even the failure of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling.
methods: A mosaic of the HRB is made using Landsat/TM imagery. The mosaic of Landsat/TM is used as the base image and all HJ-1/CCD images are automatically corrected through the image-to-image registration method. Converting the DN values of the HJ-1/CCD images to top of atmosphere (TOA) radiance with given calibration coefficients. Removing the atmospheric effects of remote-sensing images to obtain the surface reflectance. After the preprocessing has been done, all the HJ-1/CCD images within 1 month are subset and mosaicked; consequently, 10 mosaics for 10 months in the HRB are made and time series of the HRB mosaics from HJ-1/CCD are constructed.
dataset: The HJ-1/CCD remote-sensing data used in this research were provided by the China Centre for Resources Satellite Data and Application (CRESDA, http://www.cresda.com). The Landsat TM/ETM+ data were downloaded from the USGS website (http://landsat.usgs.gov/). The MODIS data were downloaded from the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (http://ladsweb.nascom.nasa.gov/). The VHSR data were from Google Earth by Google Inc.
findings: The confusion matrix is used to evaluate the classification accuracy, showing an overall classification accuracy of over 90% in the HRB, which is quite higher than previous approaches. Furthermore, a ground campaign was performed to evaluate the accuracy of crop classification and an overall accuracy of 84.09% for the crop classification was achieved.
backgroundCn: 土地覆盖数据集对于生态水文过程和地球系统建模的研究至关重要。遥感已成为广泛使用的宏观观测系统，用于土地覆盖制图，可以替代植物功能类型（PFT）作为基线。根据不同的卫星传感器，多个中等到精细分辨率的全球土地覆盖数据集可供不同研究小组使用，这些数据集在表I中详细列出。这些土地覆盖数据集的变异性很大，原因有三：1）数据质量和属性不同；2）将连续的植被覆盖分类为离散类别没有标准方法；3）它们与地球系统模型（ESM）的要求不一致，因为在ESM中使用的PFT概念，其特征代表了一组光谱关系、气候、生态和理论假设的组合，无法直接通过遥感土地覆盖数据集进行映射。此外，土地覆盖数据集的分类准确性差异很大，难以适用于流域尺度的土地过程建模和应用。光学遥感影像中土地覆盖分类的不确定性最高，通常发生在农田和草地类别之间，以及干旱地区的灌木、草地和森林类别之间，因为森林覆盖所需的最小阈值存在差异。对于HRB，大部分分布在干旱地区，因此基于当前土地覆盖数据集的HRB植被分类将导致非常大的不确定性，并可能导致生态水文和土地过程建模的重大错误甚至失败。
research objectiveCn: 为了提高HRB地区生态水文和土地过程建模的准确性，开发了一种综合方法，通过使用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据，绘制具有细致空间分辨率和更多作物/植被类别的月度土地覆盖图。
challengesCn: 光学遥感影像的土地覆盖分类中，最高的不确定性最常发生在农田和草地类别之间，以及在干旱地区的灌木、草地和森林类别之间，这主要是由于森林覆盖所需的最低阈值差异。在HRB地区，大部分分布在干旱区域，因此基于当前土地覆盖数据集的HRB植被分类将导致非常大的不确定性，并可能造成重大错误，甚至导致生态水文和土地过程建模的失败。
methodsCn: HRB的马赛克图是使用Landsat/TM影像制作的。Landsat/TM的马赛克图作为基础影像，所有HJ-1/CCD影像通过图像间配准方法自动校正。使用给定的校准系数将HJ-1/CCD影像的DN值转换为大气顶辐射率（TOA辐射率）。去除遥感影像的气象效应，以获得表面反射率。在完成预处理后，所有在1个月内的HJ-1/CCD影像被子集并拼接；因此，HRB地区制作了10个月的10个马赛克，并构建了HJ-1/CCD的时间序列马赛克。
datasetCn: 本研究使用的HJ-1/CCD遥感数据由中国资源卫星数据与应用中心（CRESDA，http://www.cresda.com）提供。Landsat TM/ETM+数据从USGS网站（http://landsat.usgs.gov/）下载。MODIS数据从NASA戈达德太空飞行中心（http://ladsweb.nascom.nasa.gov/）下载。VHSR数据来自谷歌公司（Google Inc.）的谷歌地球（Google Earth）。
findingsCn: 混淆矩阵用于评估分类准确性，HRB的整体分类准确率超过90%，这比之前的方法高得多。此外，进行了地面调查以评估作物分类的准确性，最终实现了84.09%的整体作物分类准确率。

background: Long time series of land cover changes (LCCs) are critical in the analysis of long-term climate, environmental, and ecological changes. Although several moderate to fine resolution global land cover datasets have been publicly released and they show strong consistency at the global scale, they have large deviations at the regional scale; furthermore, high-quality land cover datasets from before 2000 are not available and the classification consistency among different datasets is not very good. Remote sensing has become widely used for global land cover mapping, as it can capture the changes of land cover quickly. Until now, several moderate to fine resolution global land cover datasets have been publicly released and the spatial resolutions of these products are between 1 km and 30 m. They show strong consistency at the global scale, but they have large deviations at the regional scale. The main problems include: (1) most of the land cover datasets have a relatively low resolution (500 m and lower) and their accuracies are usually lower than 75%; among the released datasets, GlobeLand30 and FROM-GLC30 have a spatial resolution of 30 m, and their overall accuracies are 80% and 72% respectively; (2) the classification accuracy of these released datasets at the regional scale is much lower than the claimed accuracy, especially at heterogeneous areas, which is difficult to meet the modeling requirements, and (3) all the datasets are after 2000 and do not have long time series and therefore cannot support the analysis of long-term climate, environmental, and ecological changes.
research objective: Therefore, by taking the advantages of the two categories of satellite data, we proposed a new time series land cover mapping method based on machine learning and it, thereafter, is applied to Heihe River Basin (HRB) for verification purposes.
challenges: Many comprehensive classification methods, such as GlobeLand30 using Landsat series satellite data have been developed but the ones with high accuracy usually require manual intervention; thus, more than 10 years’ land cover maps with areas over 140,000 km2 do not allow a lot of manual intervention. Although methods based on time series analysis like LCMM have the capability for making high-quality land cover datasets, a 16-day revisiting period of Landsat series satellite data does not support constructing time series data at HRB. Although machine learning methods, such as FROM-GLC30 have a lot of advantages and have been employed to map land cover using remote sensing imagery, they are usually limited by sampling amount and representativity; the requirement for consistency on data of these methods cannot be met by Landsat series satellite data.
methods: Firstly, the high-quality land cover datasets at HRB from 2011–2015, which were retrieved using the LCMM method, are used for quickly and accurately making training samples. Secondly, a strategy for transferring the training samples after 2011 to earlier years is established. Thirdly, the random forest model is employed to train the selected yearly samples and a land cover map for every year is subsequently made. Finally, comprehensive analysis and validation are carried out for evaluation.
dataset: Firstly, the high-quality land cover datasets at HRB from 2011–2015, which were retrieved using the LCMM method, are used for quickly and accurately making training samples.
findings: In this study, a long time series land cover dataset including 1986, 1990, 1995, 2000, 2005, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, and 2015 is finally made and an average precision of about 90% is achieved. It is the longest time series land cover map with 30 m resolution at HRB and the dataset has good time continuity and stability.
backgroundCn: 长期的土地覆盖变化（LCCs）时间序列在分析长期气候、环境和生态变化中至关重要。尽管已经公开发布了几种中等到精细分辨率的全球土地覆盖数据集，并且它们在全球范围内表现出强一致性，但在区域尺度上存在较大偏差；此外，2000年前的高质量土地覆盖数据集并不可用，不同数据集之间的分类一致性也不佳。遥感技术已被广泛用于全球土地覆盖制图，因为它能够快速捕捉土地覆盖的变化。迄今为止，已经公开发布了几种中等到精细分辨率的全球土地覆盖数据集，这些产品的空间分辨率在1公里到30米之间。它们在全球范围内表现出强一致性，但在区域尺度上存在较大偏差。主要问题包括：（1）大多数土地覆盖数据集的分辨率相对较低（500米及以下），其准确度通常低于75%；在已发布的数据集中，GlobeLand30和FROM-GLC30的空间分辨率为30米，整体准确度分别为80%和72%；（2）这些已发布数据集在区域尺度上的分类准确度远低于声称的准确度，尤其是在异质区域，这难以满足建模要求；（3）所有数据集均为2000年后发布，缺乏长期时间序列，因此无法支持长期气候、环境和生态变化的分析。
research objectiveCn: 因此，通过利用这两类卫星数据的优势，我们提出了一种基于机器学习的新型时间序列土地覆盖制图方法，并随后将其应用于黑河流域（HRB）进行验证。
challengesCn: 许多综合分类方法，如使用Landsat系列卫星数据的GlobeLand30，已经被开发出来，但高精度的方法通常需要人工干预；因此，超过140,000平方公里的土地覆盖图在过去10年中并不允许大量的人工干预。尽管基于时间序列分析的方法如LCMM具有制作高质量土地覆盖数据集的能力，但Landsat系列卫星数据的16天重访周期并不支持在HRB构建时间序列数据。虽然机器学习方法如FROM-GLC30具有许多优势，并已被用于利用遥感影像进行土地覆盖制图，但它们通常受到样本数量和代表性的限制；这些方法对数据一致性的要求无法通过Landsat系列卫星数据来满足。
methodsCn: 首先，使用LCMM方法获取的2011年至2015年的高质量土地覆盖数据集被用于快速准确地制作训练样本。其次，建立了一种将2011年后的训练样本转移到早期年份的策略。第三，采用随机森林模型对选定的年度样本进行训练，并随后制作每一年的土地覆盖图。最后，进行全面分析和验证以进行评估。
datasetCn: 首先，2011年至2015年期间通过LCMM方法获取的高质量土地覆盖数据集被用于快速准确地制作训练样本。
findingsCn: 在这项研究中，最终制作了一个长期的土地覆盖数据集，包括1986年、1990年、1995年、2000年、2005年、2010年、2011年、2012年、2013年、2014年和2015年，并且达到了约90%的平均精度。这是HRB地区分辨率为30米的最长时间序列土地覆盖图，该数据集具有良好的时间连续性和稳定性。

background: It is very difficult to have remote sensing data with both high spatial resolution and high temporal frequency; thus, two categories of land-use mapping methodology have been developed separately for coarser resolution and finer resolution data. Land use and land cover are the key factors for understanding the interactions between global changes and human activities, such as social, economic, and cultural activities. Moreover, it is one of the key parameters of land process modeling, and more accurate land use and land cover data will improve the accuracy of ecological, hydrological, and atmospheric models. Consequently, land use and land cover data are now widely used in many kinds of researches, such as biodiversity, carbon cycle, public health, crop yield estimation, urban sprawl, forest monitoring, and so on. Since land cover/use can be retrieved straightforwardly from remote sensing, many land cover/use mapping methods using remotely sensed data have been developed for the purposes of regional or global applications.
research objective: Therefore, by taking the spatiotemporal advantage of HJ-1/CCD data we propose a new method for finer resolution land cover mapping using the time series HJ-1/CCD data, which can greatly improve the land cover mapping accuracy.
challenges: This method uses much more data and dramatically increases the computation loading; the not very good geometric and radiometric qualities of HJ-1/CCD data lower its usability and increase the difficulty in its use.
methods: In our two study areas, the very high resolution remote sensing data within Google Earth are used to validate the land cover mapping results, which shows a very high mapping accuracy of 95.76% and 83.78% and a high Kappa coefficient of 0.9423 and 0.8165 in the Dahuofang area of Liaoning Province and the Heiquan area of Gansu Province respectively.
dataset: The HJ-1 satellite constellation consists of three satellites, named as HJ-1A, HJ-1B, and HJ-1C respectively. For CCD cameras, their nominal spatial resolution is 30 m. HJ-1/CCDs have three visible bands (430–520 nm, 520–600 nm, and 630–690 nm) and one near-infrared band (760–900 nm). The time series data are composed of one dataset per month, so this time series of data can depict the variation of typical land surface.
findings: The overall accuracy for classification result using the time series of HJ-1/CCD data is 96.76% and the Kappa coefficient is 0.9423; the corresponding overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient for classification result using single Hj-1/CCD data are 87.59% and 0.8296 respectively. Compared with the classification result from single Hj-1/CCD data, the overall accuracy of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data is more than 10% and the Kappa coefficient is more than 0.1. The overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data are 83.78% and 0.8165 respectively; those using single HJ-1/CCD data are 70.82% and 0.665 respectively. It is similar to the comparison in the Dahuofang area that the overall accuracy of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data is also 10% higher and Kappa coefficient is also 0.1 higher than that of classification result using single HJ-1/CCD data.
backgroundCn: 由于高空间分辨率和高时间频率的遥感数据难以获取，因此分别为较粗分辨率和较细分辨率数据开发了两类土地利用制图方法。土地利用和土地覆盖是理解全球变化与人类活动（如社会、经济和文化活动）之间相互作用的关键因素。此外，它们是土地过程建模的关键参数，更准确的土地利用和土地覆盖数据将提高生态、水文和大气模型的准确性。因此，土地利用和土地覆盖数据现在广泛应用于许多研究领域，如生物多样性、碳循环、公共健康、作物产量估计、城市扩张、森林监测等。由于土地覆盖/利用可以通过遥感直接获取，因此已经开发了许多利用遥感数据进行土地覆盖/利用制图的方法，以满足区域或全球应用的需要。
research objectiveCn: 因此，通过利用HJ-1/CCD数据的时空优势，我们提出了一种新的方法，利用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据进行更精细的土地覆盖制图，这可以大大提高土地覆盖制图的准确性。
challengesCn: 该方法使用了更多的数据，并显著增加了计算负载；HJ-1/CCD数据的几何和辐射质量不佳降低了其可用性，并增加了使用上的难度。
methodsCn: 在我们的两个研究区域，使用Google Earth中的超高分辨率遥感数据来验证土地覆盖制图结果，显示出大连高的制图准确率，分别为95.76%和83.78%，以及较高的Kappa系数，分别为0.9423和0.8165，分别在辽宁省的大伙房地区和甘肃省的黑泉地区。
datasetCn: HJ-1卫星星座由三颗卫星组成，分别命名为HJ-1A、HJ-1B和HJ-1C。其CCD相机的标称空间分辨率为30米。HJ-1/CCD具有三个可见光波段（430–520纳米、520–600纳米和630–690纳米）和一个近红外波段（760–900纳米）。时间序列数据由每月一个数据集组成，因此这组时间序列数据可以描绘典型地表的变化。
findingsCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据的时间序列进行分类的总体准确率为96.76%，Kappa系数为0.9423；而使用单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率和Kappa系数分别为87.59%和0.8296。与单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果相比，使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率提高了10%以上，Kappa系数提高了0.1以上。使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率和Kappa系数分别为83.78%和0.8165；而使用单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率和Kappa系数分别为70.82%和0.665。与大伙房地区的比较类似，使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率也比单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果高出10%，Kappa系数也高出0.1。

Example.AnswerEn: One example is the use of multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data with different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands, as described in the research objective for improving eco-hydrological and land-process modeling accuracy in the HRB.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个例子是使用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据，如研究目标所述，以提高HRB中生态水文和土地过程建模的准确性。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a challenge faced in land cover classification using remote sensing imagery?
Example.QuestionCn:
当然可以。以下是翻译：

您能否提供一个使用遥感影像进行土地覆盖分类时面临的挑战的例子？

Example.AnswerCn: 一个挑战是，在像HRB这样的干旱地区，使用光学遥感影像对土地覆盖类别（如农田和草地）进行分类时存在较高的不确定性，特别是由于森林覆盖所需的最低阈值差异。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the specific challenges faced in classifying land-cover categories using remote sensing imagery?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 使用遥感影像对土地覆盖类别进行分类时面临的具体挑战有哪些？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: high uncertainty in distinguishing between cropland and grassland, high uncertainty among shrub, grassland, and forest categories in dryland systems, differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover, inherent variability in land-cover datasets, potential errors in eco-hydrological and land-process modeling in arid regions
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，难以区分农田和草地，灌木、草地和森林类别之间的不确定性较高，森林覆盖所需的最低阈值存在差异，土地覆盖数据集的内在变异性，以及在干旱地区生态水文和土地过程建模中的潜在错误。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges associated with land-cover classification using optical remote sensing imagery?
Definition.QuestionCn: 使用光学遥感影像进行土地覆盖分类的主要挑战有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: The main challenges in land-cover classification using optical remote sensing imagery include high uncertainty in distinguishing between similar land categories such as cropland and grassland, especially in arid and dryland systems. This is often due to differences in the minimum threshold needed for forest cover, which can lead to significant errors in eco-hydrological and land-process modeling. Additionally, data quality, classification accuracy, and the lack of standard approaches for discrete category classification contribute to these challenges.
Definition.AnswerCn: 使用光学遥感影像进行土地覆盖分类的主要挑战包括在区分相似土地类别（如农田和草地）时存在较高的不确定性，尤其是在干旱和干燥地区。这通常是由于森林覆盖所需的最低阈值差异，可能导致生态水文和土地过程建模中的显著错误。此外，数据质量、分类准确性以及缺乏离散类别分类的标准方法也加剧了这些挑战。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the methods used to improve the accuracy of long-term land-cover datasets for regional analysis?
Definition.QuestionCn: 用于提高区域分析长期土地覆盖数据集准确性的方法有哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: To improve the accuracy of long-term land-cover datasets for regional analysis, methods such as the use of machine learning models like random forest are employed. These methods leverage high-quality datasets to create training samples, which are then used to develop comprehensive time series land-cover maps. Techniques like the LCMM method for sample transfer across years and the use of multisource satellite data help construct consistent and precise datasets, achieving high classification accuracy for regional applications.
Definition.AnswerCn: 为了提高区域分析的长期土地覆盖数据集的准确性，采用了机器学习模型如随机森林等方法。这些方法利用高质量的数据集创建训练样本，然后用于开发综合的时间序列土地覆盖图。像LCMM方法这样的样本跨年转移技术以及多源卫星数据的使用，有助于构建一致且精确的数据集，实现了区域应用的高分类准确率。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In what ways do the HJ-1/CCD data's spatiotemporal advantages enhance land cover mapping accuracy compared to using Landsat series satellite data alone?
Comparison.QuestionCn: HJ-1/CCD数据的时空优势在以下几个方面增强了土地覆盖制图的准确性，相较于单独使用Landsat系列卫星数据：
Comparison.AnswerEn: HJ-1/CCD data provide a finer resolution and higher temporal frequency, which enhances land cover mapping accuracy significantly. The overall accuracy of classification results using time series HJ-1/CCD data is 96.76%, which is more than 10% higher than results using single HJ-1/CCD data, and 10% higher in comparison to using Landsat data alone, which is limited by its 16-day revisiting period.
Comparison.AnswerCn: HJ-1/CCD数据提供了更细的分辨率和更高的时间频率，这显著提高了土地覆盖分类的准确性。使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的总体准确率为96.76%，比单一HJ-1/CCD数据的结果高出10%以上，与仅使用Landsat数据相比也高出10%，后者受限于16天的重访周期。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential implications of using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data for improving land cover mapping accuracy in eco-hydrological and land-process modeling?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用多种分类器和多源遥感数据来提高生态水文和土地过程建模中的土地覆盖制图精度的潜在影响是什么？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data can potentially enhance mapping accuracy by leveraging different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands, which may address classification uncertainties between similar land covers like cropland and grassland. This comprehensive approach could lead to more accurate eco-hydrological and land-process modeling, particularly in heterogeneous or arid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用多种分类器和多源遥感数据可以通过利用不同的时空分辨率和光谱波段来提高制图精度，这可能解决类似土地覆盖类型（如农田和草地）之间的分类不确定性。这种综合方法可能会导致更准确的生态水文和土地过程建模，特别是在异质或干旱地区。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of high-quality land cover datasets from multiple years be utilized to improve the training samples for machine learning models in land cover mapping?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多年份的高质量土地覆盖数据集的整合如何用于改善土地覆盖制图中机器学习模型的训练样本？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Integrating high-quality land cover datasets from multiple years can enhance the training sample quality for machine learning models by providing a robust baseline for transferring training samples across different time periods. This strategy can help in developing consistent and accurate land cover maps over time, which is crucial for analyzing long-term environmental and ecological changes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 整合多个年份的高质量土地覆盖数据集可以提高机器学习模型的训练样本质量，为跨不同时间段转移训练样本提供稳健的基准。这一策略有助于开发一致且准确的土地覆盖地图，这对于分析长期环境和生态变化至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the variability in land-cover dataset classification accuracies when using remote sensing imagery?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响遥感影像土地覆盖数据集分类准确性的变异性因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The classification accuracies of land-cover datasets vary due to differences in data quality and properties, the lack of a standard approach for classifying continuous vegetation cover into discrete categories, and inconsistencies with Earth System Model requirements. Additionally, high uncertainty occurs in differentiating categories like cropland and grassland, especially in arid regions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土地覆盖数据集的分类准确性因数据质量和属性的差异而有所不同，缺乏将连续植被覆盖分类为离散类别的标准方法，以及与地球系统模型要求的不一致性。此外，在干旱地区，区分农田和草地等类别时，尤其存在较高的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the increase in computation loading when utilizing finer resolution land cover mapping techniques?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 使用更精细的土地覆盖制图技术时，计算负载增加的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The use of much more data in finer resolution land cover mapping techniques dramatically increases computation loading. Moreover, the not very good geometric and radiometric qualities of certain remote sensing data, such as HJ-1/CCD, lower its usability and increase the difficulty in processing, adding to the computational demands.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 使用更高分辨率的土地覆盖制图技术所需的数据量大幅增加了计算负担。此外，某些遥感数据（如HJ-1/CCD）的几何和辐射质量不佳，降低了其可用性，并增加了处理的难度，从而进一步增加了计算需求。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences on land cover classification accuracy when using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data with different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据时，对土地覆盖分类精度的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data with different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands can significantly improve land cover classification accuracy. As evidenced in the research content, this approach led to an overall classification accuracy of over 90% in the Heihe River Basin (HRB), which is higher than previous approaches.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据，可以显著提高土地覆盖分类的准确性。研究内容表明，这种方法在黑河流域（HRB）实现了超过90%的总体分类准确率，超过了以往的方法。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the use of long time series of land cover datasets impact the analysis of long-term climate, environmental, and ecological changes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 长期土地覆盖数据集的使用如何影响对长期气候、环境和生态变化的分析？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Long time series of land cover datasets allow for a comprehensive analysis of long-term climate, environmental, and ecological changes. Such datasets provide strong consistency at a global scale and support the analysis by offering insights into changes across various time periods, although challenges exist in achieving high classification consistency and accuracy at regional scales.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 长期的土地覆盖数据集允许对气候、环境和生态变化进行全面分析。这些数据集在全球范围内提供了强一致性，并通过提供不同时间段变化的见解来支持分析，尽管在区域尺度上实现高分类一致性和准确性仍然存在挑战。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the effects of utilizing time series HJ-1/CCD data on the accuracy of land cover mapping?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 利用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据对土地覆盖制图的准确性有什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing time series HJ-1/CCD data can greatly improve the accuracy of land cover mapping. The findings indicate that the overall classification accuracy and Kappa coefficient are significantly higher when using time series data compared to single HJ-1/CCD data, with improvements of over 10% in accuracy and 0.1 in Kappa coefficient.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据可以显著提高土地覆盖制图的准确性。研究结果表明，使用时间序列数据时，整体分类准确率和Kappa系数显著高于单一HJ-1/CCD数据，准确率提高超过10%，Kappa系数提高0.1。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to develop a comprehensive method for mapping monthly land cover with fine spatial resolution in eco-hydrological and land-process modeling?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文和土地过程建模中，开发一种全面的方法来绘制每月土地覆盖的细致空间分辨率是至关重要的。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: In order to improve the accuracy of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling, particularly in regions like the Heihe River Basin (HRB), a comprehensive method for mapping monthly land cover with fine spatial resolution is necessary. This is due to the high uncertainty in land-cover classification, which can lead to significant errors or failures in modeling these processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 为了提高生态水文和土地过程建模的准确性，特别是在像黑河流域（HRB）这样的地区，有必要采用一种全面的方法来以细致的空间分辨率绘制每月土地覆盖。这是因为土地覆盖分类的不确定性较高，可能导致建模过程中出现显著的错误或失败。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of using HJ-1/CCD data for finer resolution land cover mapping?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据进行更精细的土地覆盖制图具有重要意义。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Using HJ-1/CCD data is significant for finer resolution land cover mapping as it can greatly improve mapping accuracy due to its spatiotemporal advantages. This leads to a higher overall classification accuracy and Kappa coefficient, enhancing the reliability of land cover datasets for various applications.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据对于更精细的土地覆盖制图具有重要意义，因为它可以通过时空优势显著提高制图精度。这导致整体分类精度和Kappa系数的提高，从而增强了土地覆盖数据集在各种应用中的可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to preprocess remote-sensing images for land cover classification, and how do these steps contribute to the accuracy of the classification?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 遥感图像的预处理程序包括哪些步骤，以进行土地覆盖分类，这些步骤如何有助于提高分类的准确性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The preprocessing of remote-sensing images involves several steps such as using a mosaic of Landsat/TM imagery as the base image, automatic correction of all HJ-1/CCD images through image-to-image registration, converting DN values to top of atmosphere radiance with given calibration coefficients, and removing atmospheric effects to obtain surface reflectance. These steps ensure that the images are synchronized and corrected for accurate classification, contributing significantly to the accuracy of the land cover classification.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 遥感图像的预处理涉及多个步骤，例如使用Landsat/TM影像的马赛克作为基础图像，通过图像配准自动校正所有HJ-1/CCD影像，将DN值转换为给定校准系数的大气顶辐射率，并去除大气影响以获得地表反射率。这些步骤确保图像的同步和校正，以便进行准确的分类，显著提高土地覆盖分类的准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the collection and processing of high-resolution land cover data for eco-hydrological modeling?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得能够收集和处理高分辨率土地覆盖数据以进行生态水文建模？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Remote sensing advancements, particularly through platforms like Google Earth Engine and satellites such as Landsat and HJ-1/CCD, facilitate high-resolution land cover data collection. These technologies leverage spectral bands and spatio-temporal resolutions to improve data accuracy, crucial for eco-hydrological modeling.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感技术的进步，特别是通过谷歌地球引擎和卫星如Landsat和HJ-1/CCD，促进了高分辨率土地覆盖数据的收集。这些技术利用光谱波段和时空分辨率来提高数据的准确性，这对生态水文模型至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways can time series data from satellite constellations support long-term land cover change analysis?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 卫星星座的时间序列数据可以通过以下方式支持长期土地覆盖变化分析：
Enablement.AnswerEn: Time series data from satellite constellations like HJ-1/CCD enable continuous monitoring of land cover changes over extended periods. These datasets provide valuable insights into climate, environmental, and ecological changes, supporting long-term analysis with improved temporal resolution.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 来自卫星星座如HJ-1/CCD的时间序列数据能够对土地覆盖变化进行持续监测。这些数据集为气候、环境和生态变化提供了宝贵的见解，支持具有更高时间分辨率的长期分析。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might land-cover datasets exhibit significant variability at the regional scale even when they show consistency at the global scale?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 土地覆盖数据集在全球范围内表现出一致性，但在区域尺度上可能会出现显著的变异性，这可能是由于以下原因：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Land-cover datasets may exhibit significant variability at the regional scale due to differences in data quality and properties, lack of a standard approach for classifying continuous vegetation cover into discrete categories, and inconsistencies with Earth System Model requirements. Additionally, regional deviations are more pronounced in heterogeneous areas, which can impact the classification accuracy required for modeling.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 土地覆盖数据集在区域尺度上可能会因数据质量和属性的差异、缺乏将连续植被覆盖分类为离散类别的标准方法以及与地球系统模型要求的不一致性而表现出显著的变异性。此外，在异质区域，区域偏差更为明显，这可能会影响建模所需的分类准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when using time series analysis for creating high-quality land cover datasets?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在使用时间序列分析创建高质量土地覆盖数据集时，可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Challenges in using time series analysis for high-quality land cover datasets include the need for high-resolution data, which typically comes at a lower temporal frequency, and the manual intervention often required for high accuracy classification methods. Additionally, the revisiting period of available satellite data, such as the 16-day period for Landsat series, may not support comprehensive time series data construction.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 使用时间序列分析高质量土地覆盖数据集面临的挑战包括对高分辨率数据的需求，而这通常伴随着较低的时间频率，以及高精度分类方法通常需要的人工干预。此外，现有卫星数据的重访周期，例如Landsat系列的16天周期，可能无法支持全面的时间序列数据构建。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be high uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery, especially in certain vegetation categories?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么从光学遥感影像中进行土地覆盖分类可能存在较高的不确定性，尤其是在某些植被类别中？
Expectation.AnswerEn: High uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery often occurs between cropland and grassland categories, and among shrub, grassland, and forest categories in dryland systems. This uncertainty arises due to differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover and the challenges in distinguishing these categories based on spectral data alone.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 光学遥感影像中的土地覆盖分类常常在农田和草地类别之间，以及在干旱地区的灌木、草地和森林类别之间存在较高的不确定性。这种不确定性源于森林覆盖所需的最低阈值差异，以及仅凭光谱数据区分这些类别的挑战。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data for improving land cover mapping accuracy?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估使用多种分类器和多源遥感数据来提高土地覆盖制图精度的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data appears to be effective in improving land cover mapping accuracy, as it leverages different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands, leading to an overall classification accuracy of over 90% in certain regions. This approach addresses the high uncertainty often found in land-cover classifications, particularly in arid regions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 使用多种分类器和多源遥感数据在提高土地覆盖制图精度方面似乎是有效的，因为它利用了不同的时空分辨率和光谱波段，在某些地区的整体分类精度超过90%。这种方法解决了土地覆盖分类中常见的高不确定性问题，特别是在干旱地区。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What do you think is the potential impact of geometric and radiometric quality issues in time series data on land cover mapping, and how can these issues be mitigated?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 几何和辐射质量问题在时间序列数据中的潜在影响对土地覆盖制图是什么，以及如何减轻这些问题？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Geometric and radiometric quality issues can significantly lower the usability of time series data and increase the difficulty of its use. Mitigation strategies include preprocessing steps such as image-to-image registration and atmospheric correction, which are essential to improve the surface reflectance data quality, thus enhancing mapping accuracy.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 几何和辐射质量问题会显著降低时间序列数据的可用性，并增加其使用难度。缓解策略包括图像间配准和大气校正等预处理步骤，这些步骤对于提高表面反射率数据质量至关重要，从而增强制图准确性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how remote sensing data can be effectively utilized for accurate land cover mapping in eco-hydrological modeling.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定遥感数据如何有效用于生态水文模型中的准确土地覆盖制图。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Remote sensing is widely used as it provides a macro-observing system for land-cover mapping, which can substitute for plant functional type (PFT) as a baseline. Challenges include classification accuracy, particularly between cropland and grassland or in dryland systems. Various methods, such as using multiple classifiers and multisource data, are employed to improve accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 遥感被广泛应用，因为它提供了一个宏观观察系统用于土地覆盖制图，可以作为植物功能类型（PFT）的基线。面临的挑战包括分类准确性，特别是在农田与草地之间或干旱地区系统中的分类。为提高准确性，采用了多种方法，如使用多重分类器和多源数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how machine learning methods can overcome the inconsistencies in data quality for land cover classification.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白机器学习方法如何克服土地覆盖分类中数据质量的不一致性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Machine learning methods, like the random forest model, are used to train selected samples for land cover mapping. Despite limitations in sampling and data consistency, these methods benefit from high-quality datasets and strategies such as transferring training samples to improve classification accuracy and stability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 机器学习方法，如随机森林模型，被用于训练选定样本以进行土地覆盖制图。尽管在采样和数据一致性方面存在局限性，但这些方法受益于高质量的数据集和诸如转移训练样本等策略，以提高分类的准确性和稳定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of why high spatial resolution data have limitations in temporal frequency for land-cover mapping.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解为什么高空间分辨率数据在土地覆盖制图方面对时间频率有限制。
Assertion.AnswerEn: High spatial resolution data often come with challenges in temporal frequency due to the revisit period of satellites. Two separate methodologies have been developed for different resolutions, but combining high spatial and temporal resolution remains difficult. The use of time series data, like HJ-1/CCD, aims to overcome these limitations by providing monthly datasets.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 高空间分辨率数据通常由于卫星的重访周期而面临时间频率的挑战。针对不同分辨率，已经开发了两种独立的方法，但将高空间和高时间分辨率结合起来仍然困难。使用时间序列数据，如HJ-1/CCD，旨在通过提供每月数据集来克服这些限制。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the methods used for land cover mapping using remote sensing data and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of these methods.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结使用遥感数据进行土地覆盖制图的方法，并讨论这些方法的优缺点。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Land cover mapping using remote sensing data often involves using multiple classifiers and multisource data with varying spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands. Advantages include the capability to produce high-resolution and accurate land cover maps, such as those achieved with mosaic techniques using Landsat/TM and HJ-1/CCD imagery. However, challenges include high computation loading and issues with the geometric and radiometric quality of data. Machine learning methods like random forests are also employed to overcome limitations of sampling representativity and to ensure consistency across different data sources.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 使用遥感数据进行土地覆盖制图通常涉及使用多种分类器和多源数据，这些数据具有不同的时空分辨率和光谱波段。其优点包括能够生成高分辨率和准确的土地覆盖地图，例如通过使用Landsat/TM和HJ-1/CCD影像的马赛克技术所实现的。然而，挑战包括高计算负载以及数据的几何和辐射质量问题。机器学习方法如随机森林也被用来克服采样代表性的问题，并确保不同数据源之间的一致性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the main challenges in achieving high classification accuracy in land cover datasets and propose potential strategies to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在土地覆盖数据集中实现高分类准确度的主要挑战，并提出克服这些挑战的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Main challenges in achieving high classification accuracy include variability in data quality, lack of standard classification approaches, and deviations at regional scales. In particular, uncertainty arises in distinguishing between categories like cropland and grassland or among shrub, grassland, and forest in dryland systems. Strategies to overcome these challenges involve using high-quality datasets for training, employing machine learning models for improved consistency, and leveraging time series data for better temporal resolution. Additionally, methods like image registration and atmospheric correction are essential preprocessing steps to enhance data quality.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 实现高分类准确率的主要挑战包括数据质量的变异性、缺乏标准分类方法以及区域尺度的偏差。特别是在干旱系统中，区分农田和草地或灌木、草地和森林等类别时会产生不确定性。克服这些挑战的策略包括使用高质量的数据集进行训练、采用机器学习模型以提高一致性，以及利用时间序列数据以获得更好的时间分辨率。此外，图像配准和大气校正等方法是增强数据质量的重要预处理步骤。
